Reviews.Title: “Blown away”
Reviews.Author: jim501
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on it's location close to the middle of town and we could believe how great the rooms were. There was 2 couples travelling and both rooms were fantastic. The rooms were newly renovated and whilst there was still some work to be finished (dining room etc) but it didn't take away from the hotel. We loved being able to open the big doors out over looking the street, watching the people walk past. We would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice room, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: lara s
Reviews.Content: The facade of the hotel is shabby, the lobby is small yet very nice, and the hotel 2 nd lobby/ hallway is under construction, but we were so pleasantly surprised by the beautiful room. Not expecting such a luxurious room for the cheap price. The glass bathroom is newly renovated, the room looks sleek with nice views on the busy Arenal street. The air conditioner is a portable one inside the room, and slightly detracts from the sleek look but it's ok. Amazing location, some people might mind the noisy street, I'm from NYC and we slept fine. Super close to all the main sights, a 7 min. Walk to a bar/nightlife area. Everything is in close walking distance. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANTLY SURPRISED”
Reviews.Author: joanna i
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect when we booked this hotel to finish off our holiday. Our group of 8 booked 3 rooms and we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were spotlessly clean, modern and comfortable. In a fab location with the city sights including the palace just a few minutes walk away. Staff were attentive and helpful carrying luggage and arranging transport to the airport when requested. Only drawbacks none of us had any window views which was disappointing and the free standing air con units were noisy and had to have a hose draped out of the window. We would have appreciated tea/coffee facilities in the rooms but this is a personal preference. Breakfast was nice and our 4 teenagers enjoyed it!! Beware of getting a taxi from the airport though - as there was 8 of us we had to take 2 and it cost us 45 euros each taxi. The hotel will arrange a mini bus for larger partys for only 60 euros which is quite a saving. Overall a nice hotel still undergoing building works but definitely well worth the money and we would recommend it to anyone wanting to be in the centre of madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect of a city trip!”
Reviews.Author: MaartjeRoelofs
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel with low expectations. My friend and I booked a standard room and already started worrying about having no-air co. We arrived at the hotel and got room 306 on the street side. This was a ‘new’ room with was spacey, clean AND with air co! The beds were perfect and everything looked brand new. If you don’t care (much) about your hotel, than you still have to come to Francisco I for the superb location! You are right in the middle of the centre with the metro Sol on 5 minute walking distance. We loved our stay here, but I could have one comment: because of the air co, the balcony door always had to be open (even at night!) The air co made much noise itself, for light sleepers; this can be a problem. But still, would I recommend this hotel to anyone who want to go to Madrid for a city trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.... But...”
Reviews.Author: Andy S
Reviews.Content: At the time I stayed here (2007) the facilities and room were average at best, however when you're on holidays, all you need is a comfortable place to rest at the end of each day. This hotel was just that and nothing more. Clearly from other traveller's pictures there have been some upgrades. But the key is the location. This was perfect. Everything was in walking distance, especially the choclateria, the palace of ham (Palicio Del Jamon) and access to the fast train to Seville. Staff were extremely accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fab location, cannot fault”
Reviews.Author: Michelle P
Reviews.Content: Hotel is much more than 2 star. Looks as though it has recently been refurbished (and some work is still ongoing, but didn't bother/affect us) and the decor is gorgeous. Rooms are spacious, air conditioned, and the bathrooms are very nice. Free wifi throughout the whole hotel of you ask at reception for the code. The staff were very helpful & made us feel comfortable and welcome. The breakfast was nice, buffet style continental (7.30 - 10.30) and good choice. Would definitely recommend staying here and would gladly have stayed for longer than our 3 nights!! Location, 2 mins walk from the main Sol square and 5 mins from Gran Via. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Francisco I”
Reviews.Author: FelixFabio
Reviews.Content: I had to spend one night in Madrid waiting my fly for MIlan and I found a good offer in this hotel. Rooms are brand new with a "lounge" touch and service is good. The position is perfect to visit center and for restaurant- bar and nightlife. Only negative point is the noise of the street during night (but I was at 1st floor, probably in higher floors noise is less strong...) Finally a good hotel in good position.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kaygwen40
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 4 nights in Madrid. Great Hotel in a very central location. We stayed in room 503 and the noise from the pedestianised road didnt bother us. Breakfast is basic but fills you up until you have tapas in one of the numerous bars locally. A trip to the Bernabau is a must and the cable cars at the Teleferico is a great trip to escape the crowds for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Bargain Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Peter_MacPherson
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with helpful staff at a very reasonable price. We had a lovely room on the main drag Cassa Arenal with very little noise experienced at night despite being only two floors up. WIFI was free and fast, bathrooms were lovely and clean, and the hotel couldn't have been more centrally located for the restaurants, bars and art galleries etc. Breakfast was basic but it filled a hole and set up us up for the day. Only slight negative was that there was no English Speaking TV Channels i.e.) BBC, CNN etc. and no tea / coffee making facilities in the room, however, there was a coffee machine in the hall as well as plates and cutlery in case you took home any takeaways - nice touch. No way is this hotel is 2 star more like 3*+ maybe even 4 star. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessajeffriess
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed with this hotel. I wasn't expecting much considering it was half of what we'd paid for hostels on our trip but the rooms and location were fantastic and the service was exceptional. Free wifi. Do not be deceived by the cheap price. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous - couldn't get better”
Reviews.Author: conistonGlasgow
Reviews.Content: we had a great stay in this hotel, staff very helpful and friendly. Room and bathroom were first class. Great design and plenty of space in both, shower very powerful and lots of toiletries. Beds were really comfortable. I would describe it as a big boutique hotel. Spacious breakfast room at top had a children's play corner with toys, blackboard, etc. No cooked breakfast but lots of different breads, pastries, cereals, coffees, teas, jams, etc. There was a toaster and lots of ham anc cheese and juice. Soy, lactose free, full and semi skimmed milk right in middle of pedestian area, could bee a little noisy, didn't bother us, but earplugs would solve any problems. Lots of cafes and restaurants, very safe to walk around. Two metros within two/three minutes walk and ten minutes walk to palace. So central wouldn't need a travel ticket and could walk almost everywhere Very clean and towels changed daily

Reviews.Title: “Great location, deceptive from the outside”
Reviews.Author: jandmedwards
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located very close the Plaza Mayor, a very colorful and entertaining area of Madrid's old city. Being in the old city, the exterior looks a little run down, but the rooms are very modern, roomy, and beds very comfortable. The breakfast was continental style, but adequate with a reasonable selection of food. Being in the center of things, you must expect some noise during the evening and early morning from drunken revelers in the streets outside - but it was not too prolonged. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mina5303
Reviews.Content: The very best hotel I have ever stayed at during my vacations! It is 2-star, I would easily give it 3½. Located in old part of Madrid on a pedestrian shopping street, it is so central that you cannot ask for more. About 5 min walk to Royal Palace, 15 min to the three famous museums (Prado, Thyssen-Bornemisza, Reina Sofia). 2 min to the nearest metro station (Sol), but I never took the metro during my three day stay, there is simply no need if you do not want to get to the suburbs. The hotel is in an historical building next to a lovely old church (do not worry, I never heard the bells, either they do not ring or the walls are well built). Inside, it is extremely modern and looks as if it was renovated yesterday. Lifts are glass throughout and work faultlessly. Large room, large bathroom, large mirror, hairdryer, enough hangers in the wardrobe. At some hotels you need to get under the bed and pull out the cord of the bedside lamp to charge your phone, but not here! There are sockets everywhere to charge your gadgets or to use your extra things for your hair. Bed comfortable and large, both pillows and blanket very nice. The bathroom wall and doors are of frosted glass. The paint in my room was unblemished, the bathroom tiles all beautiful, and at least two dozen spotlights everywhere so you could get exactly as much or as little light as you wanted. Breakfast was included (not all Madrid hotels offer that), standard continental, nothing special, but enough of everything. There was both crusty bread and sliced one and a toaster. The attendants were around all the time to fill up and they also kept the breakfast room fresh and clean at all times. Reception staff was friendly and always present. Plenty of (tourist) restaurants and cafés in the area, at daytime lots of small shops on Calle Arenal and on side streets. A large quality department store (El Corte Inglés) is a few blocks away. Altogether, it was a much, much higher class hotel than I expected and a very pleasant stay. A real luxury for budget expense. For such a price you get a broom cabinet in some other large cities…

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel at a very good location”
Reviews.Author: GCangazi
Reviews.Content: We have booked 3 nights at this hotel on web, at half price. I wasn't expecting to much but when I entered into room "wow". The room, average size, was renewed recently and the decoration was really nice. It was very clean and it is kept clean. I've read that there are 2 parties in the hotel; one renewed and one old. So I can't tell to much about old rooms (if they still exist). Our modern designed bathroom was spacious, with a shower and two sinks. Although the room (210) was on the pedestrian street, it wasn't too noisy, I could sleep easily even on saturday. The location cannot be better! If you're looking to be in the center of everything, this is the place. You can all most go everywhere by walk. As it is on a busy street you can find anything you look for. In addition the metro station (Opera) is just next to hotel. The bed was huge and very comfortable (two big beds linked to each other for double room). There was a flat screen TV in the room (you have to put 5€ as the deposit of the remote-controller), a desk and a chair, a big and nice wardrobe, a little balcony, a safe-deposit, a minibar (no coffee or tea). There are vendor machines in the hotel from where you can buy coke, beer, coffee etc. for 1€. These are the good points of the hotel. Now I should say that there was a very bad smell in the hotel's corridors. It was terrible and I couldn't find what it was really. Fortunately it wasn't inside the room, at least in our case. It is important for me to start the day with a good breakfast but it wasn't the case at all! The hotel's breakfast was very poor. Some croissants, 1 sort of cheese and ham, cornflakes and that's all! Coffee was horrible and the orange juice was not fresh but concentrated. I think it is better to have breakfast in other places, if it is important for you.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: CoolPilot
Reviews.Content: It is a 2* hotel, however it looks like 4*. Services are percest - many amenities in rooms, good interior, everything new and clean. Breakfast was withut hot meal, however very tasty and I enjoyed it. Francisco hotel located in centre near metro stations Opera и Sol. We spent evenings out and it was safe to get back to hotel late. There were sometimes shouts on street - spanish teenagers celebrated something, but if window is closed there is no noise in rooms. So hotel is perfect for tourists and I was really hapy there.

Reviews.Title: “Right Smack at the Center”
Reviews.Author: olegnatadero
Reviews.Content: This hotel is VERY well-located on the pedestrian street of Arenal right at Madrid's center. The Plaza/Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Royal Palace, Mercado San Miguel, and Opera are at most 10 minutes away by foot. Dining and shopping venues also surround the Hotel, with souvenir shops and department stores a stone's throw away. 2 Metro stations are also accessible, Opera and Sol. The rooms are a bit dated, though very clean. For what I paid for, I certainly got great value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: dsmetcalfe
Reviews.Content: Great location just off the Puerto del Sol, literally in the middle of town! Welcoming staff, some English spoken, clean and well-appointed rooms with a small balcony. The street below was noisy but once the windows were closed this was no problem. Breakfast standard continental. The one flaw was that the internal walls seemed very thin and I could hear next door's conversation quite clearly! I would stay here again, particularly at the price I got. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Buu_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights during the New Year's celebrations. Before arriving at the hotel I was a bit wary due to some of the comments that I read on this sight. However, I must say that the hotel was exceptional, especially when you consider the price we paid during such a busy period. The only negative would be the noise in the street, which was loud, especially since we were staying on the first floor. However, to be honest, I managed to sleep through it without any problems but my friends did complain about it. The rooms were very tastefully decorated and the beds very comfortable. Great bathroom too! But the best feature of this hotel is undoubtedly its location, which is right in the heart of Madrid, just a 2 min walk to the main piazza, Plaza del Sol. As a result, we hardly needed to use the metro! Breakfast was basic but satisfactory. Overall, a great find in Madrid with great value for money!

Reviews.Title: ““Good staff, nice rooms, not many facilities, somewhat noisy.””
Reviews.Author: PaulGalway
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Francisco I for 5 nights mid -December 2011, in a clean and modern 2nd storey room with a most comfortable bed, a buffet breakfast and a flat screen TV with plently of channels, a nice mini-balcony, in the centre of the city, with very helpful staff that could all communicate through English. There was a perfectly adequate buffet breakfast. The noise from outside was annoying, especially given that this was mid-week mid-December, so if you like a quiet time ask for a room at the back--unfortunately these only make up a small percentage of the rooms. Also there is no bar or cafe service other than the breakfast, although there is a tea/coffee and a soft drink vending machine just off the lobby. 7/10

Reviews.Title: “Best buy hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: crni1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Francisco I for 3 nights and we were enjoying our stay. Clean and modern design rooms, buffet breakfast, high speed internet, great view from a balcony, perfect location in a centar of the city, decent and helpful service by the stuff, great price etc. Highly recommended place to stay in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and smelly”
Reviews.Author: Tony W
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights on a short break to Madrid. The hotel itself is in a good location, but that's about the only good point we can describe. We had room 504 which smelt like something had died in there. There was a constant smell of rotten cabbage and sewage in the room. In order to survive we had to open the window, but it was absolutely impossible to sleep because of the noise. Even if we did close the window, there was screaming and shouting all night, and all night deliveries (banging, clashing). We barely got any sleep for the entire 2 nights, and it completely ruined our holiday. The walls in the room were paper thin and even had holes in them, we could hear the people next door talking. The room supposedly had free WiFi, but we couldn't get any signal in the room. We had to go into the hallway or reception to get a signal. The hotel was under renovation, and there were better rooms. However, the staff said they couldn't move us to another room as the hotel was full. The staff aren't very friendly (apart from the guy on the night-shift). The breakfast was awful, they only had a small collection of bread, ham and cheese. The coffee was undrinkable (Extremely strong cheap coffee). I know this is a 2* hotel, but it is by far the worst 2* hotel we've ever stayed in. I highly recommend you DO NOT stay in this hotel. Apart from the excellent location, there is nothing good I can write about it.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: magda v
Reviews.Content: location is fantastic as is the breakfast. stairs are a problem but the guys will carry your bags to the lift if they are around.rooms are refurbished stylishly but ask for a door to the bathroom if you want privacy when you go to the toilet.dont book any activities or tours through the hotel. the tour company they use is chaotic and unreliable. also organise your own tickets to the bullfight- the guy who is losing his hair behind the desk charged us 30e for 11e tickets which we could easily have got on the day. we were told they were hard to get. it is our own fault for being naive but it reflects badly on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lottie61
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money and a excellent buffet breakfast, the staff are polite and helpful and we had a refurbished room on the second floor with balcony, it was noisey but we did realise it would be in the area it was, close to underground and all shops ,tapas bars and local attractions, so it was a perfect location for a 4 day city break. We took the 2 euro bus from the airport which was again good value for money and runs 24 hours a day, then a short ride on the underground to the hotel. Only thing the hotel room lacked was a full length mirror in the room, apart from that it had all you would need.

Reviews.Title: “A real bargain”
Reviews.Author: Jessie C
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried about the noise factor but it wasn't an issue at all. We had a newly decorated room at the back and were pleasantly surprised. The room was very comfortable and clean and we had no noise at night, Breakfast had a great selection with something for everyone. The location is wonderful and we were within walking distance of everything we wanted to visit and the area is full of restaurants and bars so lunch and dinner were easily taken care of. I especially found the staff very helpfull and courteous. A wonderful bargain if you are spending a few days in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: karuby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fab location, really handy for everything with plenty of restaurants and cafes close by. Staff were friendly and helpful and the room itself was fabulous gorgeous decor, extremely comfortable beds and great bathroom - all lovely and clean and modern. Dining room has not yet been refurbished in line with the rest of the hotel but it was clean and neat with a wide selection for breakfast. The street is noisy at nice but you wouldn't expect anything else in a bustling city! An absolute bargain for the price never though we'd get such quality at such a good price. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute deco and affordable prices in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Bex_Surrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. Location is fab, 2 minutes to Sol and Opera and 5 minutes to the Rastro. The hotel is being refurbushed so make sure you get one of the newly redecorated rooms, more expensive than standard ones but definitely worth the difference. Breakfast was included and it was quite good. It can however get noisy at night but this is the price to pay when yuo want to stay in the center. Wil definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel right in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: Rob111111
Reviews.Content: Perfect location between Puerta del Sol and Opera metro station, what makes this hotel one of the best located accommodation possibilities in Madrit. We had beautifull renovated double room on the 4th floor, which was really amazing. The noisy street didn't disturb me much, but.....depanding on the person..... The bathroom was huge and very comfortale. Both - room and the bathroom were very clean every day. Breakfest was also very tasty. I love this place and if you wants to spare some money, then you just have to check prices every day and catch occasion one day.....very cheap prices sometimes..... I did so and got a very cheap price. The only one very small disadvantage for me was, that my room on the 4h floor didn't have the balcony and it had small window. If you spend the whole day out of the hotel, then it's not a problem. I would advise to make it sure during making revservation if you will get the room with a balcony or not.... if having a balcony is important for you.....

Reviews.Title: “Really convinient, will come back”
Reviews.Author: Alonsote
Reviews.Content: Close to the city center Puerta del Sol, it is a really good choice, really better than local hostels in the area. For the same price (perhaps 10-20% more) you will stay in a modern and just renewed room. I have stayed the last 2 times I visited Madrid and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Madrid but very loud at night”
Reviews.Author: oxxyalmy
Reviews.Content: Rooms are new and above the 2 stars-standard but in our room it was not possible to close the window what was very annoying because the hotel is situated in a very noisy street where the people are partying till 6am every night. Breakfast was included but was very simple. Most of staff was friendly. If you don't care about noise I can fully recommend this hotel otherwise not.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leop1987
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Francisco I for three nights in July 2011 with 5 friends. All six of us were amazed at the quality of the hotel and staff considering what we paid. For less than 20 euros each a night the rooms were clean and the bathroom was very nice. The breakfast selection wasn't huge but again considering it was all included in the price we were very pleased. Far and away the best feature of the hotel is its location. It is very centrally located only two minutes walk from two metro stations and very close to shops, restaurants and bars. We had two rooms on the fifth floor and at no point during my stay was I aware of any building works in the hotel, although I appreciate this may be different if you are staying on other floors or areas of the hotel. There was some noise from the street at night, this didn't really bother me but I imagine it might be worse on the lower floors. Reception and cleaning staff were all very pleasant and I would definitely recommend this hotel for a cheap break in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book here!!!”
Reviews.Author: hamiltonians1
Reviews.Content: Very loud and busy since hotel gets refurbished currently. There were construction workers from 7.30 am every day both in the hall and outside my bathroom window! No air-con in the rooms and room window was blocked likely because of the construction work. This together makes sleeping very very hard in this Hotel. TV gives a very blurry picture, impossible to watch! Beds are very small and short (<1.90m). Poor breakfest since no varieties (only one type of ham and chesse every day). Positive about the Hotel is a fast and free internet and its great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: llovestravelling
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel! My room had a small terrace off the front of the hotel, which was a fun thing to enjoy. My only complaints are these: firm bed--if you like this you will love this place and many others in Spain, but for me it was a little too firm but I was still able to sleep; lack of clock! I had no idea how disoriented I would be without one but I was!! I purchased one after a couple days of frustration and that solved the problem! Breakfast was simple and pleasant and the location cannot be beat! Also, the windows were double paned and pretty sound proof, but it still helps to have earplugs:)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Francisco 1”
Reviews.Author: suzgra
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Francisco 1, Madrid, spain from 11th - 16th november 2010 and was not at all impressed with the very limited space for clothing. No tea or coffee making facilities in room and to ring reception for information was charged to my bill, even though it was a minimal charge. it was still unacceptable. The location of the hotel was excellent though and kind of made up for it. Would not stay there again as there are so many other beautiful hotels in same vacinity and just as cheap. Shegra, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: ipoksane
Reviews.Content: really liked this place. the location is excellent. however the street downstairs is quite noisy at night. obviously the hotel was recently renovated and they have done a good job - rooms are big and the bathroom was just perfect. breakfast was good - simple, but good.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls, rude staff, exhausting stay, vile brekkie - don't book here”
Reviews.Author: MagdaWallmont
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were in town for a brief weekend stay to attend a wedding. Upon arriving and reporting to reception, I was told by the staff that we would be upgraded to a better room. No questions were asked as to why, and this upgrade was, of course, welcomed. The ordeal started with me having to wait for over half an hour before the room was cleaned, even though we had informed the hotel of my arrival time and expected check-in time. The list of problems and inconvenience did not end here. Alarm bells started sounding when all of the floors had notices posted on the walls reading the hotel was being refurbished and that it apologises for the "inconvenience." On that note, it soon became apparent why we had been "upgraded" to another room. The following Saturday morning, we were awoken at approximately 8 a.m. by intensive, industrial-style construction work, taking place inside the hotel. Banging, drilling, hammering, loud shouting by workers across the hallway - it felt like this was taking place literally outside our room door - and indeed, this was the case. The noise of what could only be described as that of a neighbourhood being demolished was only intensified when the cleaners started their duties with wailing, old hoovers, bumping into surrounding walls and penetrating what became apparent were paper thin walls. We had a late Friday the night before and certainly did not expect to receive this sort unwanted wake-up call, especially during a weekend. The ordeal was only made worse when my very valid points of concern were bemet with rude, arrogant and unapologetic attitude by a reception staff member. He suggested I had no reason to complain seeing we had been upgraded to a 'better' room - furthermore, he completely dismissed my argument that I would have checked in to another of the dozens of hotels situated just across the street, had I known the Francisco was undergoing construction work. The reception worker angrily offered to move us to another floor as, he admitted, work would continue on the Monday. As a result we attended the wedding on very little sleep, but were very relieved that there would be a break in works on Sunday, so we could get much needed rest. Our hopes were not met when the paper thin walls proved a nightmare yet again - the cleaning staff once more started hoovering with the noisiest wailing hoovers at 8 a.m, waking us up. This hotel is impossible to sleep in! Overall, we left Madrid feeling exhausted, and more importantly, feeling cheated. The attitude and unprofessionalism of the reception staff of this hotel is shocking. Not only were they unaccommodating to guests, many did not speak any English, and proceeded with addressing guests in Spanish on the assumption they would understand. The breakfast at this hotel also left MUCH to be desired. I would strongly recommend anyone against staying here. Spend your money better at the hundreds of other hotels Madrid has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “other reviews correct but gets points for being cheap”
Reviews.Author: pessachayah
Reviews.Content: The other reviewers are right. This hotel is unbelievably loud at night, and they don't care about waking you in the morning. No frills. The only reason that it gets some points from me is that it is SO inexpensive. Other hotels I've stayed at in Spain were similar & twice the price. This hotel is great for very young students who want to party.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this one”
Reviews.Content: Such a bad experience with this hotel. We had booked for two nights and in arriving there we are informed that our reservation is just for one night. So we have to find another hotel for our second night one day before New year. We are led to our room which stinks and we are now faced to three single beds instead of the double bed we asked for. Several holes in the walls. The heating system is probably here since 1960. The bathroom is ridiculously small and here also we can notice some holes is the walls. It looks like the door has been eaten by a furious dog, same for the cupboard. The painting had some doubtful marks on it. The floor is in a pitiful state. The beginning of our trip is not really what we expected is seeing the pictures on the website. We book another hotel for two nights and still have to pay for that "hotel". Just one advice, if you go to Madrid, you can erase the hotel Francisco I of your list.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: wayfarer09
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is IDEAL. It is in walking distance of all major attractions and the ever-handy metro. The breakfast doesn't disappoint and the rooms are clean, cozy, and comfortable. The hotel is stylish and nicely furnished. The bathrooms are modern with glassy surfaces and tiled floors. The hotel staff are all family but they speak little english-but I did not feel inconvenienced as they know enough to get by. The only complaint I have of the hotel is the elevator! The stairs do not continue to the upper floors so the elevator is often necessary. If you are at all claustrophobic, stay away! The elevator is verrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrry small (can only fit 3 people at a time) but thankfully, I never had any trouble with it. Other than that minor detail, the hotel is fantastic and you should have a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: belohorizontemg
Reviews.Content: I´ve been for four days at Hotel Francisco I with my sister, and it was great. We expected for a simple hotel where we could have the convenience of an excellent location and a room just confortable, and we had both in there. When you arrive at the hotel you imagine that it´s not so good, because the reception is a little bit overdressed, but the room was great! Roomy enough with a beautiful decoration. It´s located in the heart of Madrid, we did´t even need to get a transport to locomove in the Spanish´s capital. If you´re looking for a simple hotel that it´s near of everything, there are no mistake!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT TAKE ROOM 511”
Reviews.Author: jeanmbrrr
Reviews.Content: We took a triple room in hotel Francisco I the 24-28 september. We got room nr 511. It was old, durty, and extremly small (especially for 3 persons!). Other rooms were better than this one. BUT the personal of this hotel being everething but not friendly will probably put you in this terrible room. SAY NO! Other thing: the person working in hte reception at night is extremely rude!

Reviews.Title: “Madrid”
Reviews.Author: yezadm
Reviews.Content: A very shabby hotel.....terrible rooms...very small rooms....though clean....The hotel room gets a lot of noise from the streets all through the night.....I think better options available for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean more like a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: KayeLondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Francisco for 3 nights at €45 a night - granted we were put into a superior room apparently but it was more like a 3star than 2 star as advertised. We were on the 1st floor but werent particular disturbed by the pedestrian street outside and renovations which were ongoing and at a guess, in the final stages started at 830 and werent overly noisy. The only problem were the pillows which were uncomfortable but as my sister once said, you could sleep with a slab a concrete as a pillow. Overall lovely experience in Madrid. However do not go to Bar Torre del Oro in Piazza Major - total ripoff where you feel robbed - €20 euros for small tapas plate of Gamberetti...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: tashkami
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is in renovation and it might be inconvenient for somebody, but me and a friend we stayed with liked it a lot. Mainly for the stuff, ready to help, open emotionally and very very caring. We liked the location (very centric), we liked the new renovated room with its modern design and the view. the breakfast is totally spanish and you have to admit it, still the pastry is good and fresh and tasty, and a good start of the day in Madrid)))

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zmeczonka
Reviews.Content: The only advantage I can think of is hotel's location. Apart from that, it is a disaster. Old, stinky, and dirty rooms, awful breakfast (only pastry), disguisting bathrooms. I wouln't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amber665
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally placed on a pedestrian street between the Puerta del Sol and the Opera house. The Plaza Mayor and the Real Palace are both within 5 minutes walk as are some of the many tapas bars and restaurants. The hotel is basic, but comfortable and exceptionally clean with friendly and polite staff. The rooms are of reasonable size and have a small personal safe. The bathrooms are small and although the fixtures are a bit dated, are kept very clean and the towels are changed daily. There is continual noise in the hotel, but this is unavoidable given the hotel location - take some ear plugs to ensure a good night's sleep. Breakfast is included in the price and includes a choice of cereals, bread, croissants and pastries. Coffee, a choice of teas and fruit juice is also available. The slightly bizarre lift system ensures that getting to rooms on some of the floors will involve walking up or down stairs, but the staff will help with your bags. If you are looking for a good value hotel, right in the centre of Madrid, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Excellent.....”
Reviews.Author: shnucks
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent.... Everything within walking distance.... Top floor of the hotel has just been renovated, and I'd recommend you to request a room up there.... However, bathrooms are see-through (v.European according to porter)..... But much more up-to-date than older rooms..... Rooms were old-fashioned, but clean which is the main thing.... Staff weren't unpleasant, they were ignorant..... Madrid is a great city, would definately return.... Great to shop.... Great to dine.... Great to drink...... I'll be going back.........

Reviews.Title: “nice little 2 star”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_traveller32
Reviews.Content: ok, so its a 2 star hotel. but its not bad. there are large cracks in all the walls in the hotel, i thought it was just in my room. but they are everywhere, i was in room 429 which is only a room, the bathroom/shower in down the hall and down another hall, so its inconvenient. a good location just off puerto del sol. i was only here for one night, no english channels on tele to catch up with the news. like ive said previously big cracks in the walls, it has a ceiling fan which is noisy, very noisy creaky bed, on a wooden floor, so dont turn over in bed..... i wouldnt suggest this hotel for more than one night, but thats just based on the hotel room i had. breakfast is included, i only had jam and toast with strong coffee which was delicious, but they have a few cereals, and pastries. staff seem friendly and got help with luggage upto my room which is nice for this little place. have fun, see you soon. preston

Reviews.Title: “Central, cheap, spotless”
Reviews.Author: Elle1971
Reviews.Content: We arrived back this morning, after a fabulous weekend. There's so much to do - and we couldn't fit everything in during just a couple of days... so we'll be heading back soon to do a bit more... and a bit more... and a bit more... Stayed at the Francisco I in Calle Arenal, which is halfway between the Sol & Opera districts. It was about a 5 minutes walk from the Sol Metro. Spotlessly clean, spacious rooms. the staff were extremely helpful and incredibly polite. They really couldn't help us enough. The bathroom had a toilet, bidet, shower and a sink - alll again were spotlessly clean. The room had aircon and heating (much needed during a cold January). We were on the 5th floor. The lift goes to the 4th, then it's a short flight of stairs up to your room. The breakfast was served from 7:30 until 11am each day on the top floor in a quaint (albiet slightly gothis looking dining room). The restaurant was closed when we were there, as was the bar - which was our only complaint about the hotel. Reviews had said that the noise is an issue here. Well my answer to that, is that it's town centre... so yeah... it's bound to be a bit noisy. But that didn't worry us during our stay. We'll definitely be heading back there this year. Elle xx

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TeddyCl
Reviews.Content: The location is worth it. I stayed at this hotel during an EF tour with my high school. It was the first European hotel that I had stayed in. At first, it seemed kind of old and trashy, but I think this was just in comparisson to American hotels. The old world charm grew on me after three nights, and I was really sorry to leave. My tour went to Paris after Madrid. The hotel we stayed in there was more "American" and closer to what we would consider a "nice" hotel. The problem was that we had to take the metro to the very last stop, then walk for fifteen minutes to get there. This was a huge pain. We had been spoiled by the Hotel Francisco being so close to eveything we wanted to see in Madrid (right next to Puerta del Sol) and being able to go back to the hotel whenever we needed to. We only rode the metro once in Madrid and that was because we wanted to go for a ride. The bottom line is that Hotel Fransisco is not what we Americans are used to, but its location makes up for it big time. If you don't arrive expecting a Holiday Inn Express, I'm sure you will love this hotel. It was a true Spanish experience and I would recommend it to anyone. The only complaint I have is that two of the people in our tour got stuck in the elevator. They were fine, but it made for some funny stories to tell when we got back home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blondiest
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a brilliant location,you had everything (bars,restaurants,shops etc) right on your doorstep!! the hotel was ok apart from a few minor glitches. We booked a twin room and a quad room and the quad room was fine,clean and had a separate bathroom!!!Twin room was beautiful(was in the newer part of the hotel) bar it had a see-through bathroom,completley made of glass!!! so if you dont mind watching the person who your sharing a room with going to the toilet or having a shower this would be the perfect room for you!!haha!! staff were not the friendliest apart from one young man behind the desk.We didnt vacate our room on time which i understand would be annoying to the hotel manager but we did not expect him to walk into the room as my friend could of been undressing or anything!!! other than that it was quite a pleasant stay and i would recommend it to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not Stay Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: emunoz33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from Spain...We visited several cities including Madrid. Our experience at Francisco I was by FAR the WORST OF ALL. Don't ask for a double bed room; otherwise, you would get a "whole in the wall." We had to change our room for two twin beds. Either one, the rooms are very old....We found holes in our bed sheets and towels....The breakfast was not a good deal!!! All you get is Bread, some pastry, a NASTY "orange juice" and coffee. The building is extremely noisy!!!! Not only do you hear every person walking in the street (because the windows are not sound proof) but also the cleaning crew is loud. To me, they were like a wake-up call when you did not ask for one. But the worst of all (and that's why I am writing this review) was the treatment I got from the front desk personnel (especially the midnight shift). They were very disrespectful... to say the least. My brother was visiting from London and was staying at another hotel... He was visiting me and as we were passing by the front desk, the front desk guy told us in a very "NASTY" and disrespectful way: "Let's see....Who is staying in the room?? We explained to him he was only visitor. We will come back in five minutes.. He replied: "Well, you'd better make it quick!!!, visitors are not allowed here" Of course, after this, I had to argue with this guy!! I would not let it slide. Anyway, the next morning I made a complaint with the manager but I did not get a good impression... Anyway... I will not spend a single dollar at this hotel anymore...On top of the obsolete rooms, noise, and mediocre breakfast; they don't know how to treat customers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Mihasiatat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tiny, never refurbished (at least the first 4 floors) and extremely noisy. During our three days stay, we enjoyed the neighbours conversation, the cleaners continuous chat, the workers curses, all beginning at 7.30 AM. The room was small but the bathroom had a bathtub and it was spotless. Breakfast is nothing but some toast with jam and butter, pastry, coffee and an incredibly tiny glass of "orange" juice. But the location was really great and Madrid was a pleasant surprise for us.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience, but depends on what you're looking for”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travel79
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel i ever stayed in, in what accomodation is concerned. I must say i have no reasons to complain about staff, everybody was nice and helpful. I knew this was a 2 star hotel, but i called my travel agent sunday afternoon and next day was flying to Madrid, so didn't have the time to make a good research... This hotel has a great location, thats why i said it was a bad experience for me, but depends on what you're looking for. Room we got was really dated, the oldest and smallest and worst in every way... Bathroom was also old but much better than the bedroom... The worst for me, besides room being really old, was: 1 - no air con, in the middle of July, 42 degrees (celsius) during the day and also very hot at night 2 - bedroom facing the street, with lots of restaurants and bars, and noise until 6 a.m. As you can imagine, not only i couldnt sleep with such heat in bedroom, as people singing and making lots of noise didnt help either. But, if you go on spring maybe heat wont affect you that much. Also if you go with a group of friends and want to go out at night, noise wont be a problem. For me, it was... Breakfast was also very poor, and had no freeze, i mean you had milk, butter and other things in a dinning room (also very old and with no air con) under such a heat... Take your own conclusions. I wouldnt recommend this hotel because i think its worth to pay a bit more but have at least air con, in such a hot city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mixed Quality”
Reviews.Author: Evs_family
Reviews.Content: The top floor has been refurbished and looked very nice. The lower floors were very tired. Some rooms do not have windows which I was not warned about but at least there was no street noise which was a problem if you faced the main street. Hotel was clean and breakfast was OK. It was relatively cheap and very well located in the centre: palace and main shops were 5 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad @ All!”
Reviews.Author: LovethetoHoliday
Reviews.Content: Three of us have just returned from Madrid (me, my mum & my sister) and I found the hotel to be good and serve the purpose of a short city break, the hotel was basic, the staff welcoming, room clean and off good size for three people, the breakfast was the same everyday but was fresh and tasty, the hotel’s location is fantastic and we couldn’t of asked for a more central location. Overall Madrid is a great city to go and visit, it’s compact enough to walk around (if you don’t mind walking), the metro is clean and simple however you do need to be very weary of the ‘pick-pockets’ as I had a near miss! I would recommend a trip out of the city we visited Toledo which was an hour away from Madrid and completely different, bus services are available at a very reasonable price. We all had a great time in Madrid and the weather at this time of year is just right.

Reviews.Title: “[--] hole”
Reviews.Author: ElaineIrl
Reviews.Content: This is definately the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune to stay in. The room was tiny and dull. The bathroom was the size of a wardrobe and looked nothing like the pictures shown on the website. There was no bath. only something that looked like a bath but was smaller than a shower tray!!! The first night we didnt get any sleep because it was so noisy, we might as well have been sleeping on the street as the windows were so thin we could hear everything going on outside. When the noise from outside finally quietened.. at around half 7, builders started working. The hotel was being renovated at the time... which they failed to tell us on booking!! The noise was so loud I had to ring reception and shout down the phone, only to be told that it was noise from the cleaners... ah cleaners don't use hammers and power tools! We asked could we swap to a quieter room and were given a rude unfriendly response and were given an even smaller room.. I didnt think one even existed but I was wrong. The bathroom was tiny, and old, all the door frame was rotten, and again it had no bath. We had a lovely view of scaffolding and builders mmmmm! But at least it was quiet during the night. The builders were noisy every morning though. Breakfast was terrible. You were shown to a table area which had bread and a toaster and some cereal with warm milk yuk! Anyway now that I've got that off my chest my advice is, firstly dont go to this hotel and if you're broke and have to then invest in a pair of ear plugs and a large bottle of vodka! The only good thing about this place is the location which is great but you would probably be more comfortable sleeping in a doorway! P.S There was no safety box in either of the rooms we were in. Some staff were friendly and others not at all, none had much english, and the cleaners could win an award for being the noisiest crowd of b*****s in spain!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price...Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find. It is located a few blocks from Puerta del Sol, the Plaza Mayor and the Royal Palace on Calle de Arenal. It is within walking distance to the Prado. My family and I were part of a group of students who had studied for a month in Salamanca. There were 20 of us in the group. We paid 70 euros per night for a double, breakfast included. We thought this was an excellent price for the location. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is a small lobby on the street level and a large lounge on the 1st floor. The dining area is on the 6th floor. We extended our stay after the students left, and paid 100 euros per night for a triple. The rooms are standard size for Europe. Some do not have air conditioning. The bathroom of our double was on the small side, but did have a shower and tub. Our bathroom in the triple was large. We were able to leave our luggage at no charge at the hotel when we spent two nights in Sevilla. The staff can arrainge for tickets to bullfights or sporting events, but we prefered to buy ours at the gate. This hotel has a sister hotel, Hotel Paris, located in the Puerta del Sol. We definately plan to stay here again. The only negative about this hotel is there are no smoke detectors.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Madrid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was small, extremely clean and well serviced. The staff on reception are very helpful and pleasant. Continental breakfast is adequate. I would recommend staying here for a good priced break in Madrid.
